clinical_study.brief_title: Effect of Dexmedetomidine on Postoperative Cognitive Function in Patients Undergoing Shoulder Arthroscopy With Beach Chair Position Under Desflurane Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: Investigate the effects of dexmedetomidine on postoperative cognitive function in patients undergoing shoulder arthroscopy with beach chair position under desflurane anesthesia.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postoperative cognitive decline assessed by mini-mental state examination
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 day before surgery to postoperative 1 day
primary_outcome.description: to compare cognitive decline after surgery between control and dexmedetomidine group with mini-mental state examination.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with postoperative cognitive decline assessed by a battery of psychometric test
primary_outcome.time_frame: from 1 day before surgery to postoperative 1 day
primary_outcome.description: to compare cognitive decline after surgery between control and dexmedetomidine group with a battery of psychometric test. The battery consists of copy geometric form test, two-dimensional model test, grooved pegboard test, colored block design test, puzzle test, clock drawing test.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of patients with increase of S100ß protein after surgery assessed by ELISA assay with blood of patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: from 5 min after induction of anesthesia to an 1 hour after surgery
secondary_outcome.description: S100ß protein is the biologic marker for neuroinflammation

intervention.description: Administration of dexmedetomidine at a rate 0.6 ug/kg/hr during surgery.
Administration of same amount of dexmedetomidine at a rate 0.6 ug/kg/hr during surgery.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Patients undergoing shoulder arthroscopic surgery with beach chair position
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Patients with respiratory disease
2. Patients with cardiac disease
3. Patients with cerebrovascular disease
4. patients with uncontrolled hypertension
5. Patients with dementia
6. Patients with psychiatric disease
